intro: Psychotria humboldtiana var. ornata, commonly known as the golden psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
